Description: Sharply carinated pottery bowl, handmade, with a red slipped exterior, the slip worn off towards the base. Prior to the application of the slip six groups of five shallow lines were scored almost vertically on the pot from immediately below the rim past the carination. At the carination is a single oval boss pierced horizontally. There is a shallow groove around the vessel immediately below the plain rim. A single vertical crack on the upper part of the body is flanked by a pair of repair holes.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Bibliographic references: Edwards 1998 / Gabati, A Meroitic, Post-Meroitic and Medieval Cemetery in Central Sudan (p.74, fig.4.4)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
Acquisition name: Donated by: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
